snippet: The makeshift library is a place for reading, but also for digesting what has happened, and to figure out what comes next.
abstract: Pamela Druckerman Op-Ed article describes visit to so-called Jungle in Calais, France, where several thousand migrants who have fled Africa and Middle East have set up makeshift camp close to tunnel between England and France; notes rudimentary library that has been set up in camp is very popular, which is indicative of how educated camp's denizens are; laments that no one should have to live under camp's conditions.
lead_paragraph: The makeshift library is a place for reading, but also for digesting what has happened, and to figure out what comes next.

headline.print_headline: Refugees in Calais, Reading and Waiting
headline.main: Refugees in Calais, Reading and Waiting

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
